page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: This twelve kilometre block lies to the east of{Billingham}and north of the river{Tees.}The tiny village of{ {Cowpen}(pronounced Coopen){Bewley} nestles in the north east corner with the now derelict and almost deserted areas of{Haverton Hill}and{Port {Clarence}to the south.The rest of the area encompasses good fertile farmland around{Saltholme}in the centre together with marshland and grassland. There are some factories which are part of a nearby industrial estate and a{Pruteen Plant}belonging to {I.C.I.} Pylons stretch across some of the farmland and the whole is overshadowed by the giant chemical works and the storage tanks of an oil refinery. Several small lakes and pools provide sanctuary for migrant birds.
